metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10194 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The set_text_distance function in devices/vector/gdevpdts.c in the pdfwrite component in Artifex Ghostscript through 9.22 does not prevent overflows in text-positioning calculation, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted PDF document.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10194` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ghostscript - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.8
ghostscript-x - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.8
libgs9 - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.8
libgs9-common - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ghostscript package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.8').
